sections.text: Prohibited substitutions, definitionsA disposition that is not in trust by which a thing is donated in full ownership to a first donee, called the institute, with a charge to preserve the thing and deliver it to a second donee, called the substitute, at the death of the institute, is null with regard to both the institute and the substitute.Amended by Acts 1962, No. 45, ยง1; Acts 2001, No. 825, ยง1.
